name: wehavemagnums
text:
Reading comments for Dummies: "If", not "it".

Good morning!

name: differentdog
text: in soviet russia it is always tuesday at twilight

name: carterst
text: At first I thought the ending of this strip was too much of a cheap gag, turning out Ray is talking to his mom.  But really who else but Mrs. Smuckles would nurture Ray's sense of altruistic helicopter deaths?

name: luckyg
text: I just find it strange that she's okay with him using the word "hell" - I seem to recall her not appreciating his use of language in the very beginning of the GOF arc.

name: straw
text: Well, we aren't privy to her side of the conversation, she might be chastising him the entire time.

name: featurelessvoid
text: A comment left by featurelessvoid was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, Zefiel, silver_lake, scrumpton, mustafa, Carrot, shambles, werthog42, Jewpacabra, aperson)

name: dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately
text: A comment left by dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by equinn2006, atticusonline, thescrivener, SenseiHollywood, aperson)

name: soticoto
text: Odo clearly don't know sh!t about helicopter-related deaths, being liquid 'n all.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Tuvok researched Deep Space 9 extensively before he got his Vulcan ass tossed into the Delta Quadrant.

name: dusty
text: It's not a matter of particular interest, he knows who's getting their bone on with whom throughout star fleet, and in other human organization to the extent possible. To an outside perspective it is even more obvious that this is the main factor in predicting human behavior.

name: imitationcrab
text: Certainly not Roast Beef-- which has been proven 1/10/2006

name: kingpete
text: Way to not link to the strip. I mean that. It's like a mystery for me to solve.

name: imitationcrab
text:
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuafhHHVT
My bad

name: imitationcrab
text: oops i just realized you were praising me for not adding the link instead of dogging me.  I think.  Oh well.  There it is anyway since I can't delete it.

name: overmedicated
text: Word to the wise kingpete; change your avatar. Dr. Manflesh ruins everything.

name: nigelchaos
text: Beef?

name: varnish
text: Lyle has a good point here.

name: rogergs
text: Lyle's motto is "Live fast, die young, ah, fuck all that other shit."

name: spinynorman
text: There would be nothing beautiful about the body Lyle would leave behind. The mortician would be confused by how much hair Lyle has in places where the should be no hair and the persistent reek of Mexican rotgut.

name: duskbringer
text:
I am in support of Wifflecopters: The Safe Alternative.
...and I'd just like to give a quick shout out to Andy Milonakis. Please stop stalking me.

name: doctorbaronking
text:
This might be the best introductory strip to just about anyone that likes a laugh or few. Super-A-Plus. One of the best I've read in a long while.

Also: Lyle's new glasses make him seem like he now breathes out of his mouth and knows about chainsaws.

name: wae
text: To be honest, I never doubted that Lyle breathes out of his mouth and knows about chainsaws. Perhaps not his Main Thing, but a Thing nonetheless.

name: axhoola
text: Yes, this was the strip that got me reading Achewood.

name: deimosrising
text:
My idea of how to die from helicopters is that the helicopter would run into me and I would be tossed upwards into the blades and the blades would catch hold of me and deposit me in a location where my body can be found easily and used by science.

I like to think that this is a very selfless idea of how to die from helicopters.

name: rumblefish
text: Your smug notion about how selfless your helicopter death would be turns my stomach.

name: padijun
text: Well Ray's certianly changed his tune, he used to be fascinated by marshmallows with an ear and a sideburn. http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuafhHHVT

name: mustafaqbrainmender
text: I wonder what Ma Smuckles' dream helicopter death is...

name: afronaut
text: Lyle is SO cross

name: geysershitdick
text:
You know how some people were all concerned that achewood would suck now that Beef is getting married, and weren't sure they could accept the change in tone and character that marriage would introduce?

That's how I feel about Lyle's glasses.

name: phoenixultima
text: Maybe Ray'll buy Lyle some contacts.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Lyle used to be like your worst nightmare in the local metal bar you accidently wandered into for the first time, now he looks like the worst nightmare for video store clerks who are sick of him coming in and RAVING about Shaolin Fist of Death 14 but then just renting pornos.  Chuck the shades!

name: johnnylandmine
text: I love this conversation.

name: skellingtonloc
text: Are you a Johnny Cleanslice or a Timmy Headloaf? Take our personality test and find out.

name: senseihollywood
text:
here's Timmy Headloaf...

WARNING...

you really shouldn't click on this link...

http://poetry.rotten.com/chopper/

name: overmedicated
text: Linking Rotten? Now THAT'S Old-Skool.

name: audhumla
text: Whole lot of good that helmet did.

name: zefiel
text: The Ground Traffic Controller mouse wholeheartedly agrees, yet he wears none.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Ground Traffic Controller mouse is a fine and praiseworthy avatar.  But Assetbar, unyielding, tells me that I have given out too many chubbies on this page and calls me "Friendly."

name: zefiel
text:
I think it's a chinchilla, actually


/hella hungover

name: audhumla
text: it is a mouse weighing precisely 12 oz.

name: neonfreon
text:
chinchilla tails don't start off skinny like that, but otherwise it's a chinchilla.

I would like to make a coat out of it, sir.

name: overmedicated
text:
It's a DEGU.

And personally I thought it was some sort of mid-90s 'Madchester' raver mouse with glowsticks and inexplicable headphones, as was the style at the time. Hell, I saw a dude in a club dancing in a beekeeping suit back in the day, but then again it stopped his drinks getting spiked I guess.

name: zefiel
text: bees on ectasy are pretty fearsome i guess

name: tonyhighwind
text: The hammer weighs nine pounds, tho.

name: jackparsons
text: I had to do this test when I applied to Homeland Security.

name: thommy_h
text: How does Lyle know Ray's talking about helicopter blades in the first panel?

name: unaware
text:
I don't think he does. I think he can just comment on about any blade-related topic.

He's a connoisseur.

name: homepie
text: I assume that he heard them talking about helicopters before the first panel.

name: ashoykh
text: My gut feeling was that Lyle was still scrapping for a fight over what Ray said about his new glasses.  He might have even been hoping that Ray was again dissing his glasses in some way so he could step-up.

name: professor_bear
text: Lyle's new glasses makes him look like that guy who hangs around the middle school trying to pick up chicks. You know the guy i am talking about. that guy

name: johnnylandmine
text: A math teacher?

name: boredom_man
text: A band teacher.

name: oculus
text: A comment left by oculus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by phthoggos, GeyserShitdick, Kenton)

name: rawk5tar
text: Watch it, Ray. I believe this is the exact conversation that got TuPac killed.

name: soupytwist
text: Lyle is calling that fat cat out on his helicopter blade theory.

name: senseihollywood
text: I think we should give Ray the benefit of the doubt...he does have Airwolf, after all...

name: untilyouaresonude
text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GeyserShitdick, thedudeabides85, Dwilow)

name: homepie
text: I think that the easiest compromise would be to make one blade razor sharp, and the other blade dull. Make it a bit of a gamble.

name: randombeing
text: WOW. I hain't laughed like that in a time or two. "Sorry, mom..."

name: iovine
text: I know.  It was an awesome touch.

name: gussiejives
text: This is a 5 simply for the use of the phrase Johnny Cleanslice.

name: prine
text: It's a 5 because Lyle is quivering with righteous fury over Ray's opinion on helicopter deaths.

name: gussiejives
text: That's icing on the proverbial cake.

name: tttt2
text: 'cake' is a favorite proverb of mine

name: unaware
text:
What I find fascinating is that I'm assuming the reason for the phone call was to inform Ray's mom about Beef's marriage.

How they tangent into helicopter blade edges, we'll never know.

name: neonfreon
text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, GeyserShitdick, equinn2006, le_chien_manquee, Flaaron, behka, nutmeg, Audhumla, lastlarf, havenless, Mastronaut, Centipede_Damascus)

name: zefiel
text: I won't agree to that until Asherdan says the same thing.

name: afkpuz
text:
I've waited for a conversation between Lyle and Ray like this for about a year. There's just so much between them that's left unsaid, I feel like there's a lot of thematic stuff in their relationship that hasn't really been explored.

Also, why is Lyle hiding like that in the first panel?

text: A comment left by nbgreene was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GeyserShitdick, equinn2006, lateadopter)

text: or maybe he just woke up and he's only tipsy, not quite at full lyle capacity

name: chas
text: A comment left by chas was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, stormypinkness, GeyserShitdick)

name: hungryjoe
text: That's how I initially read it as well.

name: centipede_damascus
text: A comment left by centipede_damascus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, GeyserShitdick, Dwilow)

name: audhumla
text: Every panel of this one is gold, even on a stand-alone basis

name: molesticide
text:
the glasses make lyle's anger-brow kind of less angry, less belligerent. i don't like em.

but, then again, i do like em. just in a different way. like when a good friend gets a new haircut for the first time in ten years. you're all "what the FUCK derek?" and then like a month later you don't even notice.

name: andreas52
text: This strip does everything right, and nothing wrong.  It ends with a wagged fist of righteous indignation.  Man.    Im in the Lyle camp as well on this one.  Let my viewing be of my headless body.  That'll weed out the faint of heart.

name: gormster
text: Panel 6 makes this a five.

name: pwb
text: I really dig Lyle's new eyewear, actually. I don't know what it is, but they really work on him, imo. ACE OF SHADES!

name: polygonum
text: A comment left by polygonum was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GeyserShitdick, Kybard, Mastronaut, philosophe)

name: geysershitdick
text: Actually, that is not interesting to note.???

name: factorial
text: Lyle is quivering with anger. Maybe next time Ray talks to Lyle about beheading, he won't have the same low opinion of simple blunt-bladed decapitations.

name: tombsgrave
text: This is the best conversation being had in the English language.

name: natashamarie
text: Lyle's new frames are "dad glasses" ... akin to "mom jeans"

name: afkpuz
text:
For some reason, in panel 4 Lyle's posture reminds me a lot of Larry King.

(I FIGURED IT OUT! I FINALLY FIGURED OUT WHAT THE HELL WAS GOING ON THERE!)

name: caciss
text: This strip is fresh.

name: ultramyst
text: lyle is just plain wrong. a slice any which way of my head and I would be out for good. I imagine it would end up much like fertilizer anyhow. Please review the ending of Underworld 2 for support (if it is on TV).

name: seanbad
text: Because *that* was a film noted for accuracy in physics and anatomy.

name: jackparsons
text: I acquired my MBA while sucking someone's blood.

name: paco
text: The idea the Ray is discussing this with his mother really makes my day.

name: dallovich
text: I bet this conversation is on the label of a beer botle , held by Lonis F. Edison!

name: zeal
text: Class conflict.  Helicopters.  Achewood.

name: atticusonline
text: Coming to a theater near you...

name: drago25
text: Brilliant brilliant brilliant

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Teodor: Foto-Kwiz #4.
Onstad: Golf Memoir No. 6: Going Modern
Nice Pete: A good sun-caught perch.

name: i_love_kate
text: I don't know you, Rachel Ray. I don't know of you. But I fear for you.

name: appers
text: This is probably my favourite Achewood of all time!

name: tonyhighwind
text: This is, like, Tuesday night for me.

name: mangtastic
text: Wouldn't Timmy Headloaf simply have a closed-casket funeral?

name: boheeka
text: Lyle's words in panel 6 really helped me deal with my family after I lost my job.
